message.rftoolsutility.analog.header: The Analog can do simple 'calculations' on an input redstone signal based on two side inputs
message.rftoolsutility.counter.header: The Counter can count redstone pulses upto a specified maximum (and when maximum is reached send out a redstone pulse on its own)
message.rftoolsutility.digit.header: The Digit block shows the strength of the input redstone signal
message.rftoolsutility.invchecker.header: The Inventory Checker can check for the presence of items in an inventory and send out a redstone signal
message.rftoolsutility.sensor.header: The Sensor can detect various things like mobs, players, blocks, fluids, and crop growth and send out a redstone signal under some conditions
message.rftoolsutility.sequencer.header: The Sequencer can send out series of redstone pulses given certain input signals. The sequences can optionally be repeated
message.rftoolsutility.logic.header: The Logic block can combine three input signals into one output signal given a truth table
message.rftoolsutility.timer.header: The Timer block can send out timed redstone pulses
message.rftoolsutility.wire.header: The Wire block is a very simple lag-free redstone wire. Can only do straight lines
message.rftoolsutility.tablet_redstone.h: Tablet that can be used to reference remote gui's and information
message.rftoolsutility.tablet_redstone.g: Tablet containing redstone info: right click for redstone gui, sneak right click for tablet gui
message.rftoolsutility.tablet_screen.hea: Tablet that can be used to reference remote gui's and information
message.rftoolsutility.tablet_screen.gol: Tablet containing a screen: right click for screen, sneak right click for tablet gui
message.rftoolsutility.screen_link.heade: This item can be used to refer to a screen in the world and then inserted in the Tablet
message.rftoolsutility.screen_link.gold: Sneak right-click on a screen to link
message.rftoolsutility.redstone_informat: This module can be used in the Tablet to view and control wireless redstone
Right click on a redstone transmitter or receiver to add the channel to this module
message.rftoolsutility.redstone_receiver: The Redstone Receiver can get redstone signals remotely (from a Redstone Transmitter or Button Module)
Right click on a Matter Transmitter or other Redstone Receiver to link
message.rftoolsutility.redstone_transmit: The Redstone Transmitter accepts redstone signals and sends them out wirelessly to linked receivers
Place down to create a channel or else right click on receiver/transmitter to use that channel
message.rftoolsutility.button_module.hea: A module for a Screen to send a redstone signal when pressed
message.rftoolsutility.button_module.gol: Sneak right-click on a redstone receiver to create a channel for this module and also set it to the receiver. You can also use this on a transmitter or already set receiver to copy the channel to the button
message.rftoolsutility.clock_module.head: A module for a Screen that displays the current time
message.rftoolsutility.text_module.heade: A module for a Screen that shows some text
message.rftoolsutility.counter_module.he: A module for a Screen to display the current count of a Counter block
message.rftoolsutility.counter_module.go: Sneak right-click on a counter to set the target for this counter module
message.rftoolsutility.counterplus_modul: A module for a Screen to display the current count of a Counter block
Sneak right-click on a counter to set the target for this counter module
message.rftoolsutility.energy_module.hea: A module for a Screen that allows you to display the energy status of a block
message.rftoolsutility.energy_module.gol: Sneak right-click on a machine to set the target for this energy module
message.rftoolsutility.energyplus_module: A module for a Screen that allows you to display the energy status of a block
Sneak right-click on a machine to set the target for this energy module
message.rftoolsutility.fluid_module.head: A module for a Screen that allows you to display the contents of a tank
message.rftoolsutility.fluid_module.gold: Sneak right-click on a tank to set the target for this fluid module
A module for a Screen that allows you to display the contents of a tank
Sneak right-click on a tank to set the target for this fluid module
A module for a Screen that allows you to display up to 4 slots of an inventory
Sneak right-click on an inventory to set the target for this inventory module
message.rftoolsutility.inventoryplus_mod: A module for a Screen that allows you to display up to 4 slots of an inventory
Sneak right-click on an inventory to set the target for this inventory module
message.rftoolsutility.elevator_button_m: A module for a Screen that allows you to control the Elevator
Sneak right-click on an elevator block to set the target for this module
message.rftoolsutility.machineinformatio: A module for a Screen that allows you to monitor a machine (for machines that support this system)
Sneak right-click on an supported block to set the target for this module
message.rftoolsutility.redstone_module.h: A module for a Screen that allows you display the status of a redstone channel
message.rftoolsutility.redstone_module.g: Sneak right-click on a redstone transmitter or receiver to set the channel for this module. Or else sneak right-click on the side of any block to monitor the redstone output on that side
message.rftoolsutility.charged_porter.he: This RF/charged item allows you to teleport to a previously set matter receiver. Sneak-right clickon a receiver to set the destination. Right click to perform the teleport
message.rftoolsutility.advanced_charged_: This RF/charged item allows you to teleport to a previously set matter receiver. Sneak-right clickon a receiver to set the destination. Right click to perform the teleport
message.rftoolsutility.dialing_device.he: With the dialing device you can 'dial-up' any nearby matter transmitter to any matter receiver in the Minecraft universe. This requires power. If a Destination Analyzer is adjacent to this block you will also be able to check if the destination has enough power to be safe
message.rftoolsutility.matter_receiver.h: If you place this block anywhere in the world then you can dial to it using a Dialing Device. Before teleporting to this block make sure to give it power!
message.rftoolsutility.matter_transmitte: If you place this block near a Dialing Device then you can dial it to a Matter Receiver. Make sure to give it sufficient power! Use a Destination Analyzer adjacent to this block to check destination status (red is bad, green ok, yellow is unknown). Use a  Matter Booster adjacent to this block to be able to teleport to unpowered receivers
Infusing bonus: reduced power consumption and increased teleportation speed
message.rftoolsutility.simple_dialer.hea: When this block gets a redstone signal it dials or interrupts a transmitter. Sneak-right click with this block on a transmitter or dialed receiver to set the destination
message.rftoolsutility.screen.header: This is a modular screen. As such it doesn't show anything. You must insert modules to control what you can see. This screen cannot be directly powered. It has to be remotely powered by a nearby Screen Controller
message.rftoolsutility.creative_screen.h: This is a modular screen. As such it doesn't show anything. You must insert modules to control what you can see. This creative version of the normal screen requires no power
message.rftoolsutility.screen_controller: Before screens can work they need to get power from this controller. Even a screen that has only modules that require no power will need to have a controller. One controller can power many screens as long as they are in range
Infusing bonus: increased range for screens
message.rftoolsutility.crafter1.header: This machine can handle up to 2 recipes at once and allows recipes to use the crafting results of previous steps
message.rftoolsutility.crafter2.header: This machine can handle up to 4 recipes at once and allows recipes to use the crafting results of previous steps
message.rftoolsutility.crafter3.header: This machine can handle up to 8 recipes at once and allows recipes to use the crafting results of previous steps
message.rftoolsutility.tank.header: A tank for fluids with support for filtering
rftoolsutility.category.main.description: RFTools Utility is a mod containing various useful blocks and tools
rftoolsutility.category.machines.descrip: All the machines in this mod
rftoolsutility.category.logic.descriptio: Logic Blocks are all about producing redstone signals and reacting to them
rftoolsutility.page.crafter0: The Crafter can be used to automatically craft blocks and items. The top tier version supports up to 8 different recipes$(br2)There are 26 input slots (for ingredients) and 4 output slots
rftoolsutility.page.crafter1: It is possible to $(l)Remember$() the contents of the slots with the R button. That way an input or output slot can only contain that specific item. Use the F button to forget this again$(br2)$(e)Infusing$() this machine reduces the power usage$(br2)The crafter supports the $(l:tools/filtermodule)Filter Module$(/l)
rftoolsutility.page.tank0: A container for liquids that can (by default) hold up to 32 buckets. It's possible to restrict the type of liquids by placing a bucket with the specific liquid in the filter slot
rftoolsutility.page.screen0: The Screen is a versatile block that can display all kinds of information. This depends on the modules you have installed. The Screen needs power that is remotely supplied by a nearby $(l:machines/screen_controller)Screen Controller$(/l)$(br2)$(e)Right click$() with an empty hand to open the Screen user interface
rftoolsutility.page.screen1: In the GUI you can install modules (or you can install them by right clicking the module on the screen)$(br2)Many modules (like the energy module) need a target to work on. To set that target you must first $(e)sneak right click$() the module on the machine you want to monitor
rftoolsutility.page.screen2: When the module is installed in the Screen there are also various display options that you can set by opening the specific module GUI (accessed through the normal Screen GUI)$(br2)In that GUI you can also enable 'full bright' mode and by using the wrench you can change the size and transparency of the screen
rftoolsutility.page.screen_controller0: With the Screen Controller you can power nearby $(l:machines/screen)screens$(/l). Using the 'Scan' button in the GUI you can connect to all screens in a 32x32x32 radius.$(br2)$(e)Infusing$() this machine will increase this range
rftoolsutility.page.screen_link0: Using $(e)right click$() you can link this item to a $(l:machines/screen)Screen$(/l) and after that place it in a $(l:tools/tablet)Tablet$(/l). This allows you to look at the Screen from anywhere (provided the Screen is chunkloaded)
rftoolsutility.page.matter_transmitter0: The Matter Transmitter is a device that can teleport players to any other $(l:machines/matter_receiver)Matter Receiver$(/l). Use the $(l:machines/dialing_device)Dialing Device$(/l) to dial a matter transmitter to a receiver.$(br2)$(e)Infusing$() this machine causes reduced power consumption and increased teleportation speed
rftoolsutility.page.matter_receiver0: The Matter Receiver is where a player can teleport too from a $(l:machines/matter_transmitter)Matter Transmitter$(/l). Use the $(l:machines/dialing_device)Dialing Device$(/l) to dial a matter transmitter to this receiver.$(br2)$(e)Infusing$() this machine causes reduced power consumption
rftoolsutility.page.matter_receiver1: Note that it is very important that the Matter Receiver has enough power. If not the player risks bad effects when teleporting
rftoolsutility.page.dialing_device0: With the Dialing Device you can link a $(l:machines/matter_transmitter)Matter Transmitter$(/l) to a $(l:machines/matter_receiver)Matter Receiver$(/l). Note that the Matter Transmitter has to be nearby but the Matter Receiver can be very far away (even in another dimension)$(br2)$(e)Infusing$() this machine reduces power usage
rftoolsutility.page.dialing_device1: To dial you first have to select a Matter Transmitter. If there is only one nearby then it will be automatically selected. After that you have to select a Matter Receiver (in the bottom list) and chose either 'Dial' or 'Dial Once'. With 'Dial Once' the connection will be interrupted as soon as someone teleports
rftoolsutility.page.sequencer0: The Sequencer is a versatile block that can generate specific sequences of redstone signal based on other redstone inputs. It works by selecting 64 different redstone outputs. Whenever a sequence runs it will set the redstone output of this block to this pattern in sequence$(br2)There are 7 different modes:
rftoolsutility.page.sequencer1: $(li)$(d)Once1: $()Cycle once on signal. Ignores signals until cycle is done$(/li)$(li)$(d)Once2: $()Cycle once on signal. Restart cycle on new signal$(/li)$(li)$(d)Loop1: $()Continious loop. Ignore redstone signals$(/li)$(li)$(d)Loop2: $()Continious loop. Signal resets cycle to start$(/li)$(li)$(d)Loop3: $()Continious loop while signal is enabled. Stay at current step if signal is disabled$(/li)$(li)$(d)Loop4: $()Continious loop while signal is enabled. Reset to beginning if signal is disabled$(/li)$(li)$(d)Step: $()Perform one step in the cycle on every signal$(/li)
rftoolsutility.page.timer0: The timer is a simple gate that will repeatedly send a redstone pulse. You can input any value for the delay so it can be used for very long timeouts.$(br2)What is special about this timer is that it restart when it itself receives a redstone pulse at its input. So given timely input pulses this block will never output a pulse itself. By using this feature this block can be used as a way to detect that a certain activity is overdue.
rftoolsutility.page.counter0: The counter is a simple block that will count redstone pulses and emit a redstone signal when it reaches a certain number. Then it starts over. You can see in the GUI how many redstone pulses it already got.
rftoolsutility.page.logic0: This block has three redstone inputs and one output. Using the GUI you can make any possible combination of those three inputs into a single output. For every input combination you can set the output to off, on or keep. In keep the state of the output will be the same as it was before the input was switched to this state.
rftoolsutility.page.invchecker0: This block checks a slot the inventory adjacent to its input side and emits a redstone signal in case the number of items in that slot is above a certain value (configurable in GUI).
rftoolsutility.page.sensor0: The sensor can detect various things directly in front of its input (either 1 block, 3 blocks or 5 blocks). It can detect blocks being placed, crop growth level, number of entities and so on.
rftoolsutility.page.analog0: The analog can do calculations on an input signal based on the comparison result of the A and B inputs
rftoolsutility.page.redstone_transmitter: This block will wirelessly send out a redstone signal on a specific channel when it gets a redstone signal. Use this in combination with the redstone receiver block. If you place this block down it will create a channel. You can also link this transmitter to existing channels by right clicking on another transmitter or receiver. Use a $(l:logic/redstone_receiver)Redstone Receiver$(/l) to receive redstone signals.$(br2)Using the GUI of this block you can give this channel a name which makes it easier to recognize
rftoolsutility.page.redstone_receiver0: This block will receive a redstone signal from a linked redstone transmitter. To link this receiver with a transmitter right-select the transmitter (or another linked receiver) with this block. Enabling 'analog mode' causes the power level of transmitted signals to be preserved at the receiving end. Use a $(l:logic/redstone_transmitter)Redstone Transmitter$(/l) or a Button Module in a ${l:machines/screen)Screen$(/l) to send redstone signals
rftoolsutility.page.digit0: This block simply displays a number from 0 to F (hexadecimal) corresponding to the strength of the input signal
rftoolsutility.page.redstone_information: This item can store several redstone channels ($(e)right click$() on a $(l:logic/redstone_transmitter)Redstone Transmitter$(/l) or $(l:logic/redstone_receiver)Redstone Receiver$(/l) to add the channel). You can then put it in a $(l:tools/tablet)Tablet$(/l) which allows you to examine and change redstone signals from anywhere
